definition: to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

sentences.english: I can't lose you, because you are too important for me.
sentences.chinese: 峩将県能失去你，因为你对峩来说太过重葽。

sentences.english: Last wax the incapability is over-weight and keep penetration beaded paint from peeping out ground colour.
sentences.chinese: 上蜡时不能过重，防止穿透油漆露出底色。

sentences.english: In order to attack the target with big impact angle, over compensation of gravity is added to the design.
sentences.chinese: 为了实现大落角攻击目标，进行了末制导过重补设计。

sentences.english: Students are heavily burdened with home assignments.
sentences.chinese: 学生家庭作业负担过重。

sentences.english: Australians generally believe that Corby is innocent and the punishment is too severe.
sentences.chinese: 澳洲人普遍认为科尔比是无辜，而且刑罚过重。

sentences.english: If we consume food containing excessive fat, it may lead to obesity and overweight.
sentences.chinese: 吃了过多脂肪，会引致体重过重甚或痴肥。

sentences.english: Additionally there are over 20 million children under age five who are overweight.
sentences.chinese: 另外，还有2000万五岁以下儿童体重过重。

sentences.english: The auxiliary units are called in only when the main force has been overtaxed .
sentences.chinese: 只有在主力军承受过重压力时才会召来预备部队。

sentences.english: It cannot be overlooked now that students are still overburdened.
sentences.chinese: 学生课业负担仍然过重，是当前不容回避的问题。

sentences.english: It's possible that the beam may break if the loads outweigh its supports.
sentences.chinese: 如果负荷过重，主梁的断裂是有可能发生的。

sentences.english: Students are overloaded with studies, and their eyesight suffers.
sentences.chinese: 学生课业负担过重，有损视力。
何谓体重过重和肥胖症？

sentences.english: The younger brother died of his injuries.
sentences.chinese: 而弟弟因伤势过重不治身亡。

sentences.english: The hitter swatted the ball so hard that the bat broke.
sentences.chinese: 这位击球员击球过重把球棒都打断了。

sentences.english: It seems that many people today are overweight.
sentences.chinese: 现在似乎有许多人的体重都过重。

sentences.english: The baggage is overweight and you'll have to pay $50.00.
sentences.chinese: 你的行李过重了，需要多付50元超重费。

definition: to make heavier/to emphasize/(of an illness etc) to become more serious/to aggravate (a bad situation)/to increase (a burden, punishment etc)
to lead to/to create/to cause/to bring about
due to/as a result of/thanks to/owing to/since/because
